input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: MARTINIQUAIS TOURISM COMMITTEE. Summary: Agriculture Show 2026. Description: As part of its missions to promote the destination and support impactful projects, the CMT, in support of the Chamber of Agriculture of Martinique, two satellite structures of the Territorial Collectivity of Martinique, will represent the Martinican territory during the 62nd edition of the show. In hall 7.2, “Products from Metropolitan France and Overseas”, the Martinique Tourism Committee will have a space accompanied by its partners. This 2026 edition of the SIA will highlight Martinican agriculture through the cow "Biguine" which will be the face of the 2026 edition during the 9 days of the agricultural show. This cow belongs to the Brahman breed, descended from the Indian zebu, white in color, with a silvery gray reflection. For meet the regulatory requirements linked to public procurement, the CMT plans the launch of 5 distinct batches:. Published Date: 2025-12-25. Closing Date: 2026-01-28. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Agriculture Show 2026

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: COMMUNITY OF MIRAMAS. Summary: Social and Professional Integration Benefits Supporting Various Activities. Description: By virtue of article L. 2113-13 of the Public Procurement Code, the lots, subject of the consultation, are reserved for integration structures through economic activity mentioned in article L. 5132-4 of the labor code and for equivalent structures, when they employ a minimum proportion, fixed by regulation, of disadvantaged workers. The framework agreement with the maximum specified in the CCAP is entered into in application of articles L2123-1 3° and R.2123-1 3°, L2125-1 1°, R. 2162-1 to R. 2162-6, R. 2162-13 and R. 2162-14 of the Public Procurement Code. It will result in the issuance of purchase orders. Framework agreement with purchase order concluded for a period of 1 year from the date of notification of the contract. The framework agreement may be renewed 3 times per period of one year for a total duration of the contract not exceeding 4 years according to the conditions provided for in the CCAP. The framework agreement is broken down into 6 lots. Published Date: 2025-12-25. Closing Date: 2026-01-22. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: CITY OF BESANCON. Summary: Framework Agreement for Professional Integration for the Maintenance of Public Spaces. Description: The purpose of this framework agreement is the social and professional integration of residents of Greater Besançon who are permanently excluded from the labor market or who encounter difficulties in accessing or maintaining employment. The community will entrust to the holder retained support services and employment support within the framework of socially useful activities mainly focused on the maintenance of public spaces and schoolyards in social housing neighborhoods. These paid working hours, support of the integration process, will necessarily be accompanied by a support system specific to each person. The services are to be carried out: - in the commune of Besançon, mainly in social housing districts: neighborhoods of Planoise, Clairs-Soleils/Bregille, Palente/Orchamps and "408" Cité Brûlard, Montrapon, StClaude, Zone de Témis, Malcombe, Rosemont - on the territory of GBM, mainly in the ZAEd-Ecole-Valentin, de Franois, BTC, Marnières and on some cycle paths (see CCTP for all services). Published Date: 2025-12-22. Closing Date: 2026-01-26. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Framework Agreement for Professional Integration for the Maintenance of Public Spaces

Summary: Installation of Inert Gas Extinguishing Systems for Electrical Premises on the Seine Gresillons Site. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: THE POST OFFICE. Summary: Supply and Integration of a Data Extraction, Transformation and Loading Solution and Associated Services. Description: The IT Services Department (i-TEAM Department) of La Poste wishes to acquire a software solution for extracting, transforming and loading data in SaaS or Hybrid mode and associated services. The solution will be sent to La Poste and will cover firm services on the deployment of the solution and optional services, detailed below. The language of the proposed solution and services (support, training, etc.) must be in French. The exchanges are will be exclusively in French. The application must comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). The processing of personal data of La Poste, including hosting, storage and/or consultation must must be located within the European Union (EU), a country in the European Economic Area (EEA), or a country recognized as suitable by the European Union. The solution must comply with digital accessibility obligations, and responsible design of digital services in accordance with the RGAA (General Framework for Improvement of Accessibility). The solution must also comply with the La Poste Group (PSSIG) security policy. The consultation file that will be sent to the selected service providers will specify the elements linked to this requirement. The consultation consists of a single lot. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: RATP. Summary: Reception Service and Management of Orientation and Sales Support Flows for Ratp Network Spaces. Description: The purpose of this notice is to provide reception services and guidance and sales support flows for the RATP network spaces. The services consist of ensuring a diversity of missions, both complementary and adapted to the needs of the field, each contributing to advising, informing, guiding, making travel more fluid, regulating the different modes of transport, or even supporting travelers in the purchase of transport tickets. These missions include: • Management of passenger flows, aimed at optimizing comfort and guaranteeing safety in busy areas; •Reception, information and orientation, making it possible to deliver personalized or repetitive information, and to guide travelers towards the good routes or directions; •Support for rail regulation, consisting of facilitating the rapid exit of passengers from trains, in accordance with the operator's strict instructions; •Assistance in bus regulation, including support for load of passengers, checking the absence of passengers at the end of the journey, •Reporting on accessible lines (A and B) of the presence of a Wheelchair User (UFR) requiring the intervention of an RATP agent; •Support in the choice and purchase of the transport ticket, which can go as far as the direct sale of the ticket through mobility sales. input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: PARIS AIRPORTS. Summary: Design and Implementation Process to Increase the Capacity of the Cdgval Transport System at the Paris-Charles De Gaulle Airport Platform. Description: The purpose of this consultation is to award a design/construction contract with a view to increasing the capacity of the CDGVAL transport system at the Paris-Charles de Gaulle airport platform. Indeed, in order to adapt the demand for the intra-platform transport offer, Aéroports de Paris wishes to award a design/construction contract to increase the storage and transport capacities of the CDGVAL automatic public transport system at Paris-Charles de Gaulle airport currently in operation, while perpetuating the current system. Thus, the services envisaged consist of optimizing and adding functionalities to the existing system, whose technical and functional characteristics are based on software, protocols, hardware and interfaces developed by the SIEMENS company. Indeed, the passenger carrying capacity must be increased to cope with forecasts of increased user flows, it will be necessary to achieve in particular: 1/ The construction of 3 additional storage lanes in the CDGVAL workshop garage including, among other things, the guideway, driving automation and traction energy perimeters. 2/ Adaptation of the existing automation system of the line to take into account: a/The need to increase carrying capacities; b/ the integration of trains transferred from LISA to the CDGVAL line into the network. c/ The new storage routes. 3/ The potential adaptation of.... Published Date: 2025-12-15. Closing Date: 2025-12-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Design and Implementation Process to Increase the Capacity of the Cdgval Transport System at the Paris-Charles De Gaulle Airport Platform
output.Description: The purpose of this consultation is to award a design/construction contract with a view to increasing the capacity of the CDGVAL transport system at the Paris-Charles de Gaulle airport platform. Indeed, in order to adapt the demand for the intra-platform transport offer, Aéroports de Paris wishes to award a design/construction contract to increase the storage and transport capacities of the CDGVAL automatic public transport system at Paris-Charles de Gaulle airport currently in operation, while perpetuating the current system. Thus, the services envisaged consist of optimizing and adding functionalities to the existing system, whose technical and functional characteristics are based on software, protocols, hardware and interfaces developed by the SIEMENS company. Indeed, the passenger carrying capacity must be increased to cope with forecasts of increased user flows, it will be necessary to achieve in particular: 1/ The construction of 3 additional storage lanes in the CDGVAL workshop garage including, among other things, the guideway, driving automation and traction energy perimeters. 2/ Adaptation of the existing automation system of the line to take into account: a/The need to increase carrying capacities; b/ the integration of trains transferred from LISA to the CDGVAL line into the network. c/ The new storage routes. 3/ The potential adaptation of...

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: GUADELOUPE REGION. Summary: Project Management Mandate Within the Meaning of the Provisions of Articles L2422-5 to L2422-11 of the Public Procurement Code for the Construction of the University Health Campus (Cus). Description: The Guadeloupe Region, in partnership with the State and the University of the Antilles, plans to build a University Health Campus (CUS) in Les Abymes, intended to respond to new university and research practices in the field of health. THE CUS, located next to the future CHU, will bring together in the same place many complementary players in the health field: practitioners, medical students, paramedical students, teachers, researchers, etc. The first phase of the campus will include: * a University of Training and Research (UFR) of medicine, * an Institute and School of Paramedical Training and * a simulation center, the use of which is shared between the two previous structures. The UFR and the simulation center are built for the on behalf of the State, via a project management transfer agreement between the region and the State. Thus the corresponding works will be the subject of a retrocession, from the region to the State, at the end of construction. A university restaurant and university residences, managed by the CROUS, are also planned within the campus. However, they are not part of the regional project management operation. In the longer term, in a 2nd phase, other facilities, such as a research center, a university health library, or even other equipment could be located on this campus (land reserve planned as part of the project). input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: GUADELOUPE REGION. Summary: Project Management Mandate Within the Meaning of the Provisions of Articles L2422-5 to L2422-11 of the Public Procurement Code for the Construction of the University Health Campus (Cus). Description: The Guadeloupe Region, in partnership with the State and the University of the Antilles, plans to build a University Health Campus (CUS) in Les Abymes, intended to respond to new university and research practices in the field of health. THE CUS, located next to the future CHU, will bring together in the same place many complementary players in the health field: practitioners, medical students, paramedical students, teachers, researchers, etc. The first phase of the campus will include: * a University of Training and Research (UFR) of medicine, * an Institute and School of Paramedical Training and * a simulation center, the use of which is shared between the two previous structures. The UFR and the simulation center are built for the on behalf of the State, via a project management transfer agreement between the region and the State. Thus the corresponding works will be the subject of a retrocession, from the region to the State, at the end of construction. A university restaurant and university residences, managed by the CROUS, are also planned within the campus. However, they are not part of the regional project management operation. In the longer term, in a 2nd phase, other facilities, such as a research center, a university health library, or even other equipment could be located on this campus (land reserve planned as part of the project). The regional community has def.... Published Date: 2025-12-11. Closing Date: 2026-01-31. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: TOWN HALL OF VILLENEUVE-SAINT-GEORGES. Summary: Annual Preventive Check and Curative Maintenance of Fire Equipment (Portable Fire Extinguishers, Evacuation and Intervention Plans). Description: Annual preventive verification and curative maintenance of fire equipment (portable fire extinguishers, evacuation and intervention plans) in the various municipal buildings of the Collectivity of VILLENEUVE-SAINT-GEORGES Other services may be be requested from the company such as the purchase of new fire extinguishers for replacement or due to the extension of the current fleet. The service provider must also produce and/or bring up to standard the fire protection plans and instructions for all these buildings, ensuring they are updated during maintenance visits and resuming these documents depending on the layout of the buildings if necessary. Summary: Design and Implementation Process to Increase the Capacity of the Cdgval Transport System at the Paris-Charles De Gaulle Airport Platform. Description: The purpose of this consultation is to award a design/construction contract with a view to increasing the capacity of the CDGVAL transport system at the Paris-Charles de Gaulle airport platform.<br> Indeed, in order to adapt the demand for the intra-platform transport offer, Airports from Paris wishes<br> award a design/production contract to increase the storage and transport capacities of the automatic transport system public CDGVAL of Paris-Charles de Gaulle airport currently in operation, while perpetuating the current system. Thus, the services envisaged consist of optimizing and adding functionalities to the existing system, whose technical and functional characteristics are based on software, protocols, hardware and interfaces developed by the SIEMENS company. For the first year, the annual flat-rate benefits of component 2 of the territorial pact, the notification of the framework agreement will have for effect the start of the services concerned and this notification will then constitute an order form. For subsequent years, if the framework agreement is tacitly renewed, these same services will take effect on January 1 of these two financial years. Outsourcing of support, logistics management and the maintenance of SEO tank wagons is divided into four railway maintenance functions, as defined by Implementing Regulation (EU) 2019/779 relating to the certification of entities in charge of maintenance (ECE): - Function A: supervision and supervision of functions B, C and D of the ECE, - Function B: development, updating and documentation of maintenance plans, - function C: operational management of the fleet (planning, coordination, monitoring), - function D: effective implementation preventive and corrective maintenance operations and regulatory controls. instruction: Extract and classify the tender information into structured fields such as TOT ID, Tender Notice No, Tender Value, Currency, CPV, Sector, Sub-Sector, and More Details link from the following tender text.
input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: INTERCOMMUNAL COMMUNITY NORTH REUNION. Summary: Supplies of Monitoring Equipment for Cinor 2025 Containment Systems. Description: CINOR wishes to equip itself with a robust self-monitoring system for its various containment systems in order to obtain visual and information on the state of these systems in real time and particularly in periods of crisis (cyclone, tropical storms, etc.). To this end, CINOR wishes to benefit from: • The supply of cameras and limnimetric scales, and cameras coupled with water level radar probes and pressure probes, • The installation of these devices on the various sites, • The acquisition of data from these devices and transmission on the supervision system, • The configuration and reliability of the device, • The maintenance of the system will be launched in a future market depending on the equipment which will be installed at the end of 2026 in a manner forecast.. Published Date: 2025-10-28. Closing Date: 2025-11-27. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Supplies of Monitoring Equipment for Cinor 2025 Containment Systems
output.Description: CINOR wishes to equip itself with a robust self-monitoring system for its various containment systems in order to obtain visual and information on the state of these systems in real time and particularly in periods of crisis (cyclone, tropical storms, etc.). To this end, CINOR wishes to benefit from: • The supply of cameras and limnimetric scales, and cameras coupled with water level radar probes and pressure probes, • The installation of these devices on the various sites, • The acquisition of data from these devices and transmission on the supervision system, • The configuration and reliability of the device, • The maintenance of the system will be launched in a future market depending on the equipment which will be installed at the end of 2026 in a manner forecast.
output.Sub_Sector: Security, Fire Fighting, Police and Defence

The building is intended to accommodate all the equipment necessary for agricultural and market garden activity. In particular, it will have to allow the parking of machines, operators' vehicles, storage of production from production and various technical rooms specific to the needs of operators. In addition, office and life spaces will also be integrated into the building. The commissioning is scheduled for September 2028. The market is divided into 4 phases:- Phase 1: Definition of need- Programming,- Phase 2: Call for Applications- Choice of candidates,- Phase 3: in the realization of the work (until the end of the GPA). input: Country: France. Purchaser Name: DIJON METROPOLE. Summary: Dijon Metropole - Portage of the Territorial Reception and Integration Contract of Dijon Metropole (Ctai). Description: The contract relates to the following services: Dijon Metropole - Portage of the territorial reception and integration contract of Dijon Metropole (CTAI). Territorial reception and integration contracts (CTAI) improve the lives of refugee and foreign people by involving the territories where they reside and by coordinating the action of local actors. These are calls for projects managed by the interministerial delegation at the reception and integration of refugees (DIAIR) as well as the General Directorate of Foreigners in France (DGEF). Contracts are signed jointly by volunteer prefectures and local authorities in order to implement concrete actions for the attention of international protection (BPI) and first-time foreigners. Public or private organizations, in particular associations governed by The 1901 law may apply for this consultation. Actions, generally carried out by associative partners and sometimes by the community, meet identified needs thanks to the establishment of a shared initial diagnosis, in particular in terms of access: - to training linguistics; - access to rights; - care; - employment; - sports and cultural offers; - the development of links with the host company. Dijon Metropole was one of the very first communities signatory to a CTAI in 2019 with the ambition to strengthen L'Arimat .... Published Date: 2025-09-08. Closing Date: 2025-09-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

It will give rise to the emission of purchase orders. Each batch will be allocated to an economic operator. Each batch will be the subject of a framework agreement and the candidates have the possibility of submitting offers for all lots. This evolution follows the establishment of the unified security platform Security Center of the company Genetec and Ineo. <br>. Published Date: 2025-07-21. Closing Date: 2025-09-03. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Supply and Maintenance of a Video-Protection and Associated Material Solution
